text.p: A cyclonic storm headed for Bangladesh on Saturday after veering away from southeast India.
Weathermen warned fishermen in the northern Bay of Bengal to stay near the coast and be ready to race for shelter on short notice.
The deep depression 880 km (550 miles) southwest of Chittagong was packing winds of 60 kph (40 mph) with gusts up to 80 kph (50 mph), the Storm Warning Centre in Dhaka reported.
It was expected to get stronger and move northeast.
Thousands of people had earlier begun to flee inland from the coast of India's Andhra Pradesh, where a similar storm claimed 971 lives on November 7.
Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister N. Chandrababu Naidu told reporters in Hyderabad "We are a bit relaxed since the cyclonic threat has receded."
